awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Some Initial-Boundary-Value Problems arising from New Constitutive Equations for the Creep of Ice
awd_abstract_narration: This research program investigates the solvability in the large            of initial-boundary value problems for two classes of third order               systems of nonlinear partial differential equations.  These two                 classes of equations have been proposed as more sophisticated models            for ice mechanics which incorporates the effects of primary and                 secondary creep of polycrystalline ice.  The stability of the solution          of the initial-boundary value problem will also be analyzed.                         The research results are expected to have a significant impact on          glaciology and Artic engineering,
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY RESEARCH FOUNDATION, THE
